metadata.name: Certificate Exported Via Certutil.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of the certutil with the "exportPFX" flag which allows the utility to export certificates.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\certutil.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('certutil.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-exportpfx ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/exportpfx ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('–exportpfx ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('—exportpfx ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('―exportpfx '))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of the certutil with the "exportPFX" flag which allows the utility to export certificates.

metadata.objective: False positive: There legitimate reasons to export certificates. Investigate the activity to determine if it's benign Reference: https://www.splunk.com/en_us/blog/security/a-golden-saml-journey-solarwinds-continued.html
